title: C04-1011

sentences.text: We consider the problem of computing the Kullback-Leibler distance , also called the relative entropy , between a probabilistic context-free grammar and a probabilistic finite automaton .
We show that there is a closed-form -LRB- analytical -RRB- solution for one part of the Kullback-Leibler distance , viz the cross-entropy .
We discuss several applications of the result to the problem of distributional approximation of probabilistic context-free grammars by means of probabilistic finite automata .

kg2text: The problem of computing involves calculating the Kullback-Leibler distance, also known as relative entropy. This concept measures the difference between two probability distributions and has a solution for the cross-entropy, which represents a specific part of this distance. The Kullback-Leibler distance is also referred to as relative entropy. Probabilistic context-free grammars have been approximated by probabilistic finite automata, with both models recognizing patterns in strings of symbols using probability theory.
